item.title: Excerpts of Academic English
item.description: Excerpts Deduction differentiating (1.4) with respect to time gives Similarity At this stage, we can reproduce the argument of [20]. The proof is done along a similar line, but estimates near the boundary are more crucial. Now we take the reflection process of [20]. Brevity We drop the suffix $n$ for simplicity of writing. Obviousness The following lemma is elementary, but we provide with the proof for completeness. Those are preliminaries to the proof but have their own interests.
